title: How to Make Wasabi Mashed Potatoes

steps.headline: Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
steps.description: Add the potato quarters, and boil until tender.

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes and return to the pot.
Mash thoroughly with a potato masher.
Slowly add the butter, broth, and spices while continuing to mash.
Put the potatoes in the cooking pot or saucepan.
steps.description: Cover with water. Bring to the boil and cook until tender.

steps.headline: Add the sour cream and milk.
steps.description: You don't need to add all of the milk; it depends on the consistency you like.

steps.headline: Add the potatoes to a saucepan.
steps.description: Cover with cold water and a pinch of salt. Bring to the boil, then reduce and cook until tender.

steps.headline: In a separate saucepan, heat the butter, cream and milk gently.
steps.description: Stir frequently to melt the butter.

steps.headline: Add the wasabi paste to the mixture.
steps.description: Season with salt and pepper to taste. If using salted butter, take the existing salt content into account. Add more wasabi if you think it needs it.

steps.headline: Drain the potatoes.
steps.description: Put the potatoes back into the saucepan and heat for another minute or so to remove any remaining liquid.

steps.headline: Drop the cooked potatoes into a mixing bowl.
steps.description: Add the butter mixture. Mash together.

steps.headline: Add the chives.
steps.description: Stir through. It's now ready to serve.

text: Garlic wasabi mashed potatoes Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Add the potato quarters, and boil until tender. Drain the potatoes and return to the pot.  Mash thoroughly with a potato masher.  Slowly add the butter, broth, and spices while continuing to mash.  Serve hot.  Creamy wasabi mashed potatoes Put the potatoes in the cooking pot or saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to the boil and cook until tender. Remove from the heat. Drain. Add the sour cream and milk. You don't need to add all of the milk; it depends on the consistency you like. Add the wasabi paste. Mash everything together well. Season with salt and pepper. It's now ready to serve. Chives and wasabi mashed potatoes Add the potatoes to a saucepan. Cover with cold water and a pinch of salt. Bring to the boil, then reduce and cook until tender. In a separate saucepan, heat the butter, cream and milk gently. Stir frequently to melt the butter. Add the wasabi paste to the mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. If using salted butter, take the existing salt content into account. Add more wasabi if you think it needs it. Drain the potatoes. Put the potatoes back into the saucepan and heat for another minute or so to remove any remaining liquid. Drop the cooked potatoes into a mixing bowl. Add the butter mixture. Mash together. Add the chives. Stir through. It's now ready to serve. Finished.
